title: Image
description: This element describes the actual image that was acquired and its meta-data. The elements that are references (ending in Ref or Settings) refer to elements defined outside of the Image element. Ref elements are simple links, while Settings elements are links with additional values. If any of the required Image attributes or elements are missing, its guaranteed to be an invalid document.

subCategoriesOrder.Image: This element describes the actual image that was acquired and its meta-data. The elements that are references (ending in Ref or Settings) refer to elements defined outside of the Image element. Ref elements are simple links, while Settings elements are links with additional values. If any of the required Image attributes or elements are missing, its guaranteed to be an invalid document.
subCategoriesOrder.Instrument: This empty element refers to the Instrument that was utilized to acquire this image.
subCategoriesOrder.Experiment: This empty element refers to the Experiment during which this Image was acquired.
subCategoriesOrder.Experimenter: This empty element refers to Experimenter that performed this experiment.
subCategoriesOrder.ExperimenterGroup: This empty element refers to the ExperimenterGroup that owns this Image.
subCategoriesOrder.TIRFSettings: Defines the TIRF settings used for this experiment.
subCategoriesOrder.ImagingEnvironment: This describes the environment in which the biological sample was kept during the acquisition of this image.
subCategoriesOrder.MicroscopeSettings: This element refers to the microscope used to acquire this image and it holds the settings that were applied to the microscope during this acquisition.
subCategoriesOrder.ObjectiveSettings: This element refers to the objective used to acquire this image and it holds the settings that were applied to the objective during this acquisition.
subCategoriesOrder.OpticalCalibration: This describes the procedure that was used for optical calibration and the resulting calibration measurements.
subCategoriesOrder.DetectorCalibration: This procedure measures the performance of the dectector.
subCategoriesOrder.Plane: Each Image has to have at least one Plane and one Channel. The Plane element holds microscope stage and image timing data for a given channel/z-section/timepoint. The total number of Plane elements for a given Image must equal to SizeZ x SizeC x SizeT.
subCategoriesOrder.Channel: Each Image has to have at least one Plane and one Channel. The Channel element stores information about how the each image channel was acquired. The total number of Channel elements for a given Image must equal to SizeC.
subCategoriesOrder.BinData: The contents of this element are base64-encoded.  These are not CDATA sections just a base64 stream.
subCategoriesOrder.TiffData: This describes the location of the pixel data in a tiff file.

Name.description: A user assigned name for this Image.

ID.description: A unique identifier for this Image.

AcquisitionDate.description: The acquisition date of the Image.

SizeX.description: X size of the pixel data array.

SizeZ.description: Dimensional size of pixel data array.

SizeC.description: Dimensional size of pixel data array.

SizeT.description: Dimensional size of pixel data array.

PhysicalSizeX.description: Physical width of a pixel expressed in µm.

PhysicalSizeY.description: Physical height of a pixel expressed in µm.

TimeIncrement.description: This attribute is used for time series that have a global timing specification instead of per-timepoint timing info. For example in a video stream.

DimensionOrder.description: The order in which the individual planes of data are interleaved.

ChannelOrder.description: The order in which the channels were acquired and are stored.

PixelType.description: The variable type used to represent each pixel in the Image.

SignificantBits.description: The number of bits within the type storing each pixel that are significant. e.g. you can store 12 bit data within a 16 bit type. This does not reduce the storage requirements but can be a useful indicator when processing or viewing the image data.

Interleaved.description: How the channels are arranged within the data block: true if channels are stored RGBRGBRGB...; false if channels are stored RRR...GGG...BBB...

BigEndian.description: This is true if the pixels data was written in BigEndian order. If this value is present it should match the value used in BinData or TiffData. If it does not a reader should honour the value used in the BinData or TiffData. This values is useful for MetadataOnly files and is to allow for future storage solutions.

Description.title: Description
Description.description: This is a simple multi-line comment or annotation describing this component.

Tier.description: The tier level of this component.
